alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Coastal Camden; Coastal Glynn; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Southern Ware; Wayne; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 12:14AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nassau, central Baker, Camden, Glynn, southeastern Pierce, Brantley, southeastern Ware, Wayne and Charlton Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1213 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jesup to near Waynesville to near St. George. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingsland, Brunswick, Jesup, Hilliard, Folkston, Woodbine, Callahan, Nahunta, Dock Junction and Stephen Foster State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Coastal Camden; Coastal Glynn; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Southern Ware; Wayne; Western Charlton
